hotKeys.title: Hot Keys
hotKeys.description: The input of T, F, p, q, r, and s can be done with or without using the shift key.

instruction.begin: Select an exercise to get started!
instruction.create: Write the formula for your own exercise

instruction.begin: Select an exercise to get started!
instruction.create: Write the formula for your own exercise

buggy.absor2: You have applied absorption incorrectly: pay attention to which subformula you keep.
buggy.andcompl: You have applied a complement rule incorrectly.
buggy.andcompl2: You have applied a complement rule incorrectly.
buggy.assimp: You have incorrectly applied associativity to an implication.
buggy.assoc: Associativity is only allowed on similar connectives (either only conjunctions or only disjunctions).
buggy.commimp: You have incorrectly applied commutativity to an implication.
buggy.demorgan1: You have applied De Morgan incorrectly, don't forget the negation signs.
buggy.demorgan2: When applying De Morgan, don't forget to remove the negation sign outside of the brackets.
buggy.demorgan3: When applying De Morgan, don't forget to change the conjunction into a disjunction.
buggy.demorgan4: When applying De Morgan, don't forget to change the disjunction into a conjunction.
buggy.demorgan5: When applying De Morgan, take care where you place the brackets. You have inadvertently changed the application range of the negation.
buggy.distr: You have applied distribution incorrectly. Take care where you put the conjunctions and where you put the disjunctions.
buggy.distrnot: You have forgotten a negation when applying distribution.
buggy.equivelim1: You have applied equivalence definition incorrecly. Take care of the negation signs.
buggy.equivelim2: You have applied equivalence definition incorrecly. Take care of the place of the disjunctions and conjunctions.
buggy.equivelim3: You have applied implication definition instead of equivalence definition.
buggy.falseprop: You have applied an F-rule incorrectly.
buggy.idemequi: Idempotency does not apply to equivalences, only to conjunctions and disjunctions.
buggy.idemimp: Idempotency does not apply to implications, only to conjunctions and disjunctions.
buggy.implelim: You have applied implication definition incorrectly.
buggy.implelim1: The rule for implication definition uses a disjunction instead of a conjunction.
buggy.implelim2: You have applied equivalence definition instead of implication definition.
buggy.implnotelim: You forgot the negation in front of the implication.
buggy.notoverimpl: You are not allowed to distribute a negation sign over an implication. First rewrite the implication and then apply De Morgan.
buggy.orcompl: You have applied a complement rule incorrectly.
buggy.orcompl2: You have applied a complement rule incorrectly.
buggy.orsame: You have applied a T-rule incorrectly.
buggy.parenth1: You are not allowed to move a negation sign. You can apply De Morgan, but remember both negations and switching the conjunction into a disjunction sign or vice versa.
buggy.parenth2: Take care of the brackets. Remember to keep the negation out of the brackets when applying equivalence definition.
buggy.parenth3: Double negation can only be applied if both negations apply to the same subformula.
buggy.trueprop: You have applied a T-rule incorrectly.
buggy.andcompl.inv: You have applied a complement rule incorrectly.
buggy.orcompl.inv: You have applied a complement rule incorrectly.
buggy.trueprop.inv: You have applied a T-rule incorrectly.
buggy.falseprop.inv: You have applied an F-rule incorrectly.
buggy.idemimp.inv: Idempotency does not apply to implications, only to conjunctions and disjunctions.
buggy.idemequiv.inv: Idempotency does not apply to equivalences, only to conjunctions and disjunctions.
buggy.demorgan3.inv: When applying De Morgan, don't forget to change the conjunction into a disjunction.
buggy.demorgan4.inv: When applying De Morgan, don't forget to change the disjunction into a conjunction.
buggy.distr.inv: You have applied distribution incorrectly. Take care where you put the conjunctions and where you put the disjunctions.

hint.full: Rewrite this formula using the [[rule]] rule to {{formula}}.

syntaxError.missingOperand: There is a missing operand at index {{index}}: {{formula}}
syntaxError.ambiguougAssoc: The associativity of operators is ambiguous at index {{index}}: {{formula}}
syntaxError.missingOperator: There is a missing operator at index {{index}}: {{formula}}
syntaxError.missingClose: The opening parenthesis at index {{index}} is missing a closing parenthesis: {{formula}}
syntaxError.emptyParentheses: The parentheses at index {{index}} are empty: {{formula}}
syntaxError.unexpectedChar: There is an unexpected character at index {{index}}: {{formula}}

error.noRule: You must indicate which rule you have applied
error.notChanged: You have not changed the equation
error.wrongStep: You have performed an incorrect step
error.wrongRule: You have chosen an incorrect rule
error.similar: No changes have been made. Both terms have remained the same.
error.correctNotVal: This formula is equivalent with the last, but you have either performed multiple steps at once or performed an incorrect step.
error.invalidFormula: This formula has an incorrect syntax

incomplete.twoWay: The proof is not yet completed

error.notEquivalent: The two expressions are not equivalent.
error.identical: You have to specify two different formulas.
error.creatingExercise: An error occured while creating the exercise. Did you create a valid exercise?
error.validatingExercise: An error occured while validating the exercise. Please try again.
error.generatingExercise: An error occured while creating the exercise. Please try again.
error.solvingExercise: An error occured while showing the complete proof. Please try again.
error.solvingNextStep: An error occured while showing the next step. Please try again.
error.solvingNextStepInv: Next step cannot be shown. There's an incorrect step in your solution
error.solvingLastStep: An error occured while showing the next step. There are no more steps.
error.showingHint: An error occured while showing the help for the next step. Please try again.
error.validatingStep: An error occured while validating the step. Please try again.
error.noStepPossible: The formula is in normal form.
